I struggle to tear it open, my hands shaking with anger. The paper cracks and crinkles under my grasp. Inside, there's just a single sheet of lined notebook paper, filled with her neat, looping script. I scan the lines, my eyes widening at each word.

She dares to apologize? To say she misses me? After everything that happened? **How could she?** Doesn't she understand how much this hurts? How could she send this and expect anything but anger in return?

I crumple the letter in my fist, crushing it until it's a tight ball. I don't notice the other things - the small, heartfelt words about our past, the mention of her new job, the subtle hint at a possible reconciliation. All I see is red, all I feel is anger. She should have known better than to send this. She should have known how it would make me feel.

I storm out of the office, leaving the mess behind me. I don't notice the other letters on my desk, unopened but not ignored like hers. I don't see how the rest of my life is moving forward while I'm stuck in this moment of anger and resentment. All I know is that she should have known better. She should have done something different. Anything but this.
